books.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel set in the Depression-era South, about a lawyer who defends a black man against a false rape charge.

books.name: The Great Gatsby
books.description: A classic American novel about the wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the married Daisy Buchanan.
A dystopian novel set in a future totalitarian society, where government surveillance and control are omnipresent.

books.name: Pride and Prejudice
books.description: A romantic novel set in Georgian England, about the Bennet family and their five daughters.

books.name: The Catcher in the Rye
books.description: A coming-of-age novel about the rebellious teenager Holden Caulfield, who is expelled from his prep school.

books.name: The Hobbit
books.description: A fantasy novel about a hobbit named Bilbo Baggins, who embarks on a journey with a group of dwarves to reclaim their treasure from a dragon.

books.name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.description: A magical realist novel about the Buendía family, set in the fictional town of Macondo in Colombia.

books.name: Brave New World
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a future world where people are genetically engineered and conditioned to conform to a rigid social hierarchy.

books.name: The Diary of a Young Girl
books.description: A memoir about the experiences of a young Jewish girl and her family, who were in hiding during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands.

books.name: The Lord of the Rings
books.description: A high fantasy novel about hobbits, elves, dwarves, and other creatures, and their quest.
